3.metadata: "Mission: Impossible", shooting draft, revised by Robert Towne

28.metadata: NOTE: THE HARD COPY OF THIS SCRIPT CONTAINED SCENE NUMBERS

29.metadata: AND SOME "SCENE OMITTED" SLUGS. THEY HAVE BEEN REMOVED FOR

39.scene description: We're in a large closet.  JACK KIEFER, an athletic Americanin his late thirties wearing a headset, is wedged into acorner, staring at a television screen.

44.scene description: The television shows a surveillance view of the living roomthat lies outside the confines of the closet.  The TV imageis in black and white.  JACK shifts, trying like hell to getcomfortable but he's been there a while

52.scene description: A bare bulb shines down on the contents of a shabby hotelroom.  Directly under the blub a man, GENNADY KASIMOV, sitsin a straight backed wooden chair in his blood-stained T-shirt.  There are a couple of THUGS and a stray HOOKER in theroom behind him.  A legend:

62.scene description: KASIMOV is sobbing.  Uncontrollably.  A MAN enters the room,ANATOLY, an imperious Russian in his forties, a Russiangodfather.  The THUGS and HOOKERS are ushered out.  ANATOLYlooks down at KASIMOV pitiously and urges him to go and sitby him in a chair he picks up for him.  KASIMOV does as he isbid, looking gratefully up at ANATOLY.  They speak in Russianwhich is subtitled.

66.dialogue: Kasimov, Kasimov, good that you calledus.

77.scene description: ANATOLY gets up out of the chair and goes to a bed across theroom.  A WOMAN lies half under the sheets.  She's lying in anunnatural position on the bed, and the sheets are smearedwith blood.  She's dead.  ANATOLY lifts her eyelid.

82.dialogue: I don't even know how I got here.I swear, Anatoly, I never touched her!  Ididn't lay a finger on her.

84.scene description: ANATOLY moves away from the WOMAN.

95.dialogue: Jesus, she's been under too long.  Come on, come on!

100.dialogue: You're the only one who can help me.

103.scene description: Desperately he tugs at ANATOLY'S jacket.  But ANATOLY hits his hand away and smacks him around the head.

119.scene description: ANATOLY paces up the room, away from KASIMOV.

123.dialogue: You asked for my help.  You asked for myhelp...come on...

133.dialogue: The name pal...give us the name.

139.dialogue: The contact in Minsk..the contact in Minsk..works in a travel agency.

165.scene description: Back on screen, ANATOLY places a hand on KASIMOV'S shoulderas if he had just anointed him.

171.scene description: In the closet, JACK types the name into a computer and cross checks -- "MIEDIEV" comes up, then "posting/American consulate/Kiev."

175.scene description: JACK turns and nods to a WHOREHOUSE WAITRESS in costume in the closet next to him, dressed in traditional Russian tunic and virtually no bottom.  She quickly leaves.

181.scene description: We enter the room for the first time as the WAITRESS does. She's carrying a tray with a bottle of vodka and two shot glasses.

186.scene description: He pours them out and hands one to KASIMOV.

199.scene description: He drinks.  He blinks.  Something felt funny about that. Dizzied, KASIMOV swoons and passes out on the floor. ANATOLY moves to the closet door and opens it.

203.scene description: ANATOLY reaches up to his face --

209.scene description: --and tears away a mask of flesh.  He's no middle aged Russian mobster, he's ETHAN HUNT, an American in his early thirties.  He gestures to KASIMOV contemptuously.  JACK hands ETHAN a hypodermic kit and he goes quickly back into the room.

216.scene description: Immediately, there is activity, and PEOPLE everywhere.  TWO OTHERS come into the room and carry KASIMOV out.

222.scene description: ETHAN goes quickly to the body of the dead woman. He cheeks the pulse in her neck, shines a penlight in her eye. He strips the adrenalin kit and jabs the long needle into the dead woman's thigh.  He checks her pulse again, checking a stopwatch.  In about ten seconds, the woman's eyes open.

226.scene description: CLAIRE is her name, a French woman of thirty or so. She half rolls over, GROANS, and wipes some of the blood from her mouth.

232.dialogue: We got it.  On your feet.

235.dialogue: I want to sleep.  Can I sleep here.

252.scene description: Meanwhile, MEN in overalls take apart the room.  The ceiling lifts right off the walls, and the walls themselves start to come down, revealing the "hotel room" to be an elaborate set in the middle of an empty warehouse.

257.scene description: JACK comes into the room from the closet.  He hands CLAIRE her jewelry, including a watch and a wedding ring.  ETHAN stops what he's doing, noticing.  She looks up at him questioningly.

261.dialogue: Are you all right Ethan.  What's wrongwith you?

265.dialogue: If you're gonna do this again Claire, It's not gonna be on my watch.

273.scene description: JACK comes into the room from the closet.  He hands CLAIRE her jewelry, including a watch and a wedding ring.  ETHAN stops what he's doing, noticing.  She looks up at him, questioningly.

283.scene description: She almost unconsciously slips the wedding ring onto her finger.  ETHAN notices.  He turns and SHOUTS to the room at large.

287.dialogue: IS THERE ANY PARTICULAR REASON WE'RE NOT OUT OF HERE YET?!

294.scene description: He walks across the room and out the door.  CLAIRE, worried, clutches her hands together, glancing down at her wedding ring.

306.scene description: -- and come out on another wedding ring, this one on a MAN's finger. One of several he's drumming on an arm rest in the plush first class cabin of a commercial airliner.  He shoves some money into his wallet, and as he does so we catch a fleeting glimpse of a photograph of CLAIRE.

308.scene description: The pilot's voice makes an announcement.

314.dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, we have leveled off at our cruising altitude of thirty-eight thousand feet-and we should be arriving in Prague right on schedule.

317.scene description: A FLIGHT ATTENDANT makes her way between the seats, passing out menus.

320.dialogue: Would you like to watch a movie Mr Rosen?

322.scene description: A passenger takes one.  The ATTENDANT continues on.

327.dialogue: Would you like to watch a movie Mr Phelps?

332.scene description: The MAN with the wedding ring looks up.  JIM PHELPS is in his mid-forties, good-looking, intense.  He's a tired man, and not just now, it's a profound fatigue.  He looks up at the ATTENDANT and smiles warmly.

338.scene description: A look crosses the FLIGHT ATTENDANT'S face; her tone becomes stilted.

342.dialogue: Would you consider the cinema of theUkraine?

345.dialogue: Perhaps you'd choose one for me.

349.scene description: The ATTENDANT turns and walks away.  PHELPS sits back, shakes a cigarette out of a pack, and taps it nervously on the armrest.

351.scene boundary: AT THE FRONT OF THE CABIN.

355.scene description: The FLIGHT ATTENDANT opens a case loaded with video 8 cassettes of feature films.  She opens a panel in the top of the case and withdraws a tape hidden back there.

360.scene description: The ATTENDANT returns with the tape and hands it to PHELPS. He takes it without a word and she moves on.

366.scene description: PHELPS reaches down and turns a lever on the support between his seat and the empty one beside him. He flips up a small movie screen and angles it toward himself, away from the other passengers. He puts on a headset, opens a door in the armrest, and puts the tape in.

376.scene description: the image of a man comes on.  EUGENE KITTRIDGE is fortyish, but seems permanently stuck in the Nixon era -- horn rimmed glasses, short short haircut, rather be caught dead than tieless.  But if he catches your eye, he will never, ever look away.  He's seated at a desk, looking into the camera.

386.scene description: The screen winks and shows an image of GOLITSYN, a burly man in his forties.  The image is herky-jerky videotape, presumably taken from a concealed camera as GOLITSYN walks down a foreign street.

395.dialogue: -- a former KGB Line X officer now working the international black market selling intelligence.  This morning, we learned that Golitsyn has stolen one half of a CIA NOC list, the list of our non- official cover agents working in Eastern Europe.

399.scene description: The screen shows an image of what such a list might look like, code names and other information scrolling by on a computer screen at high speed.

409.dialogue: For security reasons, the NOC list is divided into two encoded halves. Golitsyn already has the cryptonym portion, which contains agent code names and targeting areas.  This portion is useless unless combined with the second half -- the true name list that is kept in the CIA station in our Embassy in Prague.

413.scene description: The Embassy itself comes on screen, a beautiful old building at the base of the Charles Bridge, which spans the Vltava River.

426.dialogue: We believe Golitsyn plans to steal the true name list at an Embassy function tomorrow night.  Your mission, should you decide to accept it, is to obtain photographic proof of the theft, apprehend those involved, and return the stolen list.  I don't have to stress the importance of this matter, Jim.  We're keeping it internally black. Because of  its urgency, I've already sent to Prague a team selected from your usual group.

429.scene description: Still photographs come on screen, some of which we're already seen -- JACK KIEFER, CLAIRE and ETHAN.

434.dialogue: Ethan Hunt will of course be your point man, as usual.  He's in Kiev; we're getting word to him now.

439.scene description: PHELPS sits back in his seat, closes his eyes, and rubs his tired brow.  KITTRIDGE himself comes back on the tape.

447.dialogue: As always, should you or any member of your IM force be caught or killed, the Secretary will disavow all knowledge of your actions.  This tape will self- destruct in five seconds.  Good luck, Jim!

452.scene description: -- the tape in the armrest starts to smolder, sending up a plume of wispy smoke --

455.scene description: -- and PHELPS exhales, concealing the plume in a cloud of cigarette smoke.

462.scene description: SARAH and HANNA, a German woman in her mid-thirties enter. Another legend:

469.scene description: The IMF team's safe house is a sparsely furnished Prague apartment with a panoramic view of the city.

476.scene description: The IMF team is scattered around the room. Sketches, pads, overfilled ashtrays and equipment are strewn everywhere. JACK and SARAH seated next to each other - JACK demonstrating the VISCO glasses to her.  CLAIRE is seated opposite JACK at the computer.  JIM and ETHAN are in the kitchen.  HANNAH taking a roll of black-out curtain through the room.

482.dialogue: Look to your right, then back to me. There's a camera built right into the bridge.  Whatever you see it sees and transmits it back here.  Can you hear me?

485.dialogue: Of course I can hear you.

490.dialogue: No, in your...ear piece. You have a lovely smile (eyes). Can you hear me now?

502.dialogue: Why don't you take a look?

508.dialogue: That's what we do isn't it?

514.dialogue: Too wicked to have a drink later?

517.dialogue: I think I might just take that look.

519.scene description: ETHAN and JIM PHELPS are in a heated conversation.

523.dialogue: Yeah, well, Jim, fact is I've got more than ninety days leave coming.

527.dialogue: A hundred and sixty-seven, I think it is. Take it all, if you want.  After this one.

530.dialogue: I thought I'd take some now.

543.dialogue: I don't know, I had to go to Chicago again.  You were in Kiev.  You tell me.

551.dialogue: When you started noticing your short term memory loss.  What the problem was you and Claire had in Kiev?

572.dialogue: Because I can't afford it. And because you'd burn up before you'd burn out.

575.scene description: CLAIRE, who is at the computer behind them, somehow seems to be the reference point in the following exchange:

592.dialogue: Wonderful.  Ran into a convention of auto dealers at the Drake Hotel.  You hear the one about the astronaut who comes back from the first manned flight to Mars after two years?  His wife's got a year old kid.  So he says "All right.  Who was it?  My friend Harry?"  She says no. "Oh,it was my friend Sammy."  She says it wasn't Sammy.  "Oh, I suppose it was my friend Lou."  "No, what's the matter, don't you think I have any friends of my own?!"

595.scene description: PHELPS laughs.  ETHAN doesn't.  The back of CLAIRE'S head is in his line of sight.

599.dialogue: Boy, you really are grim. Come here, take a look.

601.scene description: He leads ETHAN to the window, which overlooks the city.

623.dialogue: Beyond Charles Bridge there is our Embassy.  See it?  Tomorrow night, if anything goes wrong, this guy will steal the names of our agents in every country all over Eastern Europe.  Up for grabs to the highest bidders -- third world terrorists, arms dealers, drug lords -- any and everybody who'd love to get rid of long term coverts like us, and some very dear friends among them.  If they're exposed, they'll be executed.  Come over here.  Take a lock at this.

628.scene description: CLAIRE, who is working at a computer, has pulled up a quicktime video image in a box on her screen.  In it, an old edition of the McLaughlin Report, the PBS news show, is playing.

635.scene description: SENATOR WALTZER, a bearded, bespectacled man in his forties, is holding forth:

647.dialogue: I'll go you one further.  I say the CIA and all its shadow organizations have become irrelevant at best and unconstitutional at worst.  It's time we throw a little light on the whole concept of the Pentagon's "black budget."  These covert agency subgroups have confidential funding, they report to no one -- who arethese people?!  We were living in a democracy the last time I checked.

660.dialogue: Isn't he chairing the Armed Services hearing?

665.dialogue: Not this week. This week he's flyfishing at the Oughterard Slough in County Kildare, with one of our best Irish guides.

668.dialogue: He won't be back in a hurry?

672.dialogue: No, not in a hurry.  What do you think? You think the plot'll work?

675.dialogue: Sure.  If the main character does.

679.dialogue: If you were me, Ethan, who would youtrust to make him believable?

681.scene description: JACK comes breezing in with a piece of bubble gum.

689.scene description: JACK shows the gum to ETHAN.

693.dialogue: Stick of gum. If you come up against a lock you can't pick --

695.scene description: Half the gum is red, the other half is green.

700.dialogue: Red light.  Green light.  Mash them together, asta lasagna.  Don't get any on you -- you have five seconds.

702.scene description: He offers the gum to ETHAN.

708.scene description: CLAIRE glances up from the computer and catches ETHAN's eye. PHELPS may have caught the glance, but is focused on ETHAN.

725.scene description: The American Embassy glitters beside the Vltava River.  Party at the Embassy tonight.

733.scene description: JACK, wearing black coveralls and slightly odd-looking eyeglasses (they're called Visco glasses), enters an elevator shaft through a small door at the base of the wall.  He looks up the shaft, shining a flashlight until he finds what he's looking for --

735.scene description: -- a gray metal box, protruding from the wall one floor up.

743.scene description: PHELPS is at a table in the safe house apartment, watching the bank of monitors HANNAH wired together earlier. The monitors are alive now, showing various views of the inside of the Embassy, where the party is going on, and one view of the elevator shaft.

745.scene description: PHELPS wearing an IMF headset and speaks into the mouthpiece.

749.dialogue: Ethan.  Jack's inside.  Window's open by twenty-three hundred.

754.scene description: Inside the Embassy, the party is a formal, tuxedoed affair that's in full swing on the second floor.

758.scene description: SENATOR WALTZER, the man who was on TV, walks up a grand staircase, headed in.  An AMERICAN DIPLOMAT in a tuxedo hurries up to him.

764.dialogue: How do you do, Senator, I'm Rand Housman, the Ambassador's aide.  If I could just steer you through the reception line here--

767.scene description: The DIPLOMAT pilots the SENATOR by one arm, guiding him to a reception line at the base of the stairs to the party.

772.dialogue: Allow me to introduce Jaroslav Reid, the director of the National Gallery -- Petr Brandl, the mayor of Prague --

775.scene description: SARAH, a very attractive young American dressed in an elegant gown, steps out of the reception line and shakes hands with

779.dialogue: I bet you don't remember me, do you, Senator?

783.dialogue: Of course I do.  How are you, Miss Norman?

786.scene description: He leans in and kisses her on the cheek, and as he does so SARAH whispers something in his ear.

789.dialogue: He's in pocket.  Under the archway behind me.

791.scene description: Her tone, her words -- we realize she's on the team.

795.scene description: The SENATOR pulls a pair of Visco glasses from his pocket (and if we didn't know the SENATOR was ETHAN before, this confirms it), puts them on, and looks up, over her shoulder.

797.scene boundary: UNDER AN ARCHWAY NEAR THE ENTRANCE,

800.scene description: ALEKSANDER GOLITSYN, the Ukrainian, has just come in from outside.

806.scene description: PHELPS sees the SENATOR's point of view of GOLITSYN, through the glasses, broadcast back to PHELPS' monitor.  He speaks into his microphone.

809.dialogue: Sarah, mark the package and go to two.

813.scene description: SARAH still has the SENATOR's attention.

818.dialogue: Your advance team mentioned you'd want a tour of the facility, so I've gone ahead and set that up for you --

827.scene description: He slips an arm around SARAH and they walk off, not into the party, but the other way, toward a staircase that leads further into the Embassy.

837.scene description: JACK climbs up the elevator shaft, towards the gray metal box.  He just begins to remove the cover when he hears a noise from above.  He looks up and sees the elevator above him descending.

841.scene description: JACK quickly pulls himself flush against the wall. The elevator comes down adjacent to him and stops, pinning him to the wall.

852.scene description: As the SENATOR and SARAH pass behind the entering GOLITSYN, SARAH pulls a small bottle of perfume from her purse.  But as she sprays, she points it slightly to the left, missing herself and hitting the back of GOLITSYN'S head.  He never notices.  They move on and down the flight of stairs.

858.scene description: JIM PHELPS monitors the Visco views of the party.  He looks to the fourth monitor and checks a view of the party, a jumpy one, as someone hurrying up stairs.

866.scene description: On a flight of stairs, HANNAH, dressed for the party and slightly out of breath, hurries up the stairs.

874.scene description: She also has a pair of Visco glasses, which she trains on the party below.  She pushes a micro switch on the side of her glasses, activating an electronic filter, which tints the lenses.

878.dialogue: Hannah, pull the shade (or - Hannah go tonight vision).

884.scene description: the party looks the same, but one head in the crowd stands out.  That head is GOLITSYN'S, his hair a fluorescent green where SARAH sprayed it.

886.scene boundary: INT. THE DENIED AREA/ELEVATOR BANK - NIGHT

890.scene description: The SENATOR (let's just call him ETHAN) and SARAH come down the stairs and pass a sign that says "Denied Area -- Political Attaches Only."  ETHAN checks his watch.  23:00.

894.scene description: He nods to SARAH, they round a corner, and come to an elevator at the end of the corridor.  A sign in front of it says "Out of Order."  They head for it anyway.

897.scene description: A MARINE GUARD appears from behind a side door, catching them by surprise.

900.dialogue: Governor's in position.  We have the elevator.

903.dialogue: Excuse me, can I help you?

908.dialogue: -- which leads directly to the Denied Area, the only limited access area in the whole facility.

910.scene description: SARAH flashes an ID at the GUARD and keeps talking.

915.dialogue: As you can see. this area has both a Marine guard and video surveillance, and is strictly monitored at all times.

919.scene description: She walks up to the thumbprint analyzer on the elevator bank and slides her thumb inside.  The panel lights up and flashes a message -- "ACCESS DENIED."  SARAH and ETHAN trade a look.

926.scene description: She tries the thumb again, Still no soap.

932.dialogue: Jack?  I believe we did have a young man named Jack.  Not a reliable man, as I recall.  Constantly late or behind in his work.

935.scene description: Now the GUARD, noticing that Sarah's not being allowed access, comes closer to them.

938.dialogue: Excuse me, let me see that ID again!

943.scene description: JACK is still pinned to the wall by the elevator, listening to their conversation.

947.dialogue: Jack's pinned down Sarah.  Should be a second.  Keep dancing.

955.scene description: Finally, the elevator moves down a floor and JACK is freed.

959.dialogue: Relax your crack, Foghorn, I'm workin' onit.

963.scene description: He quickly opens the gray metal box, revealing a maze of circuitry.  He patches in his computer, climbs on top of the elevator, and hits the keyboard, beginning to download.

968.scene description: there's a split-screen of SARAH's thumbprint and the ID picture.  JACK downloads her file into the security computer.

970.scene boundary: INT. THE DENIED AREA/ELEVATOR BANK - NIGHT

974.scene description: Ignoring the GUARD, SARAH turns and slides her thumb into the thumbprint analyzer once more.  The panel glows, this time the message flashes --

978.scene description: -- and the elevator doors slide open briskly.

980.scene description: The GUARD, surprised, now catches sight of the SENATOR.

986.scene description: He snaps a salute.  ETHAN and SARAH get into the elevator and the doors close behind them.

991.scene description: JACK looks down at the elevator below.  Through a grating, he can see them inside.

995.dialogue: The drink (date) with Sarah is definitelyoff.

1000.scene description: PHELPS moves from JACK's view of the elevator car to HANNAH's view of the party on his video monitors.

1010.scene description: HANNAH, stationed on the second floor of the Embassy, moves to get a better view of the party. She reacquires GOLITSYN's glowing head.

1013.dialogue: He's heading to the denied area.

1020.scene description: This work room is filled with combination lock filing cabinets and various computer terminals.  ETHAN hands SARAH his Visco glasses and she crosses the room, placing them upside down on top of a filing cabinet.

1023.scene description: ETHAN straps on a Visco wrist monitor and tunes it in, switching several times.

1040.scene description: the view of the main computer terminal is upside down, but clear.  Anyone sitting there will be recorded.

1046.scene description: On PHELPS' monitor, we see ETHAN, via his Visco glasses on the filing cabinet, standing next to the computer.  PHELPS barks out a warning.

1049.dialogue: Get moving, Ethan.  He's rolling to you.

1054.scene description: ETHAN pushes the elevator button but the elevator is already moving up.

1064.scene description: In a split view, we see both sides of the elevator wall simultaneously -- on one side, JACK is lying on top of the rising elevator, on the other side, ETHAN and SARAH are waiting for it to arrive.

1072.scene description: The elevator stops, the doors open --

1075.scene description: -- and GOLITSYN gets on.  GOLITSYN descends in the elevator with JACK on top and ETHAN and SARAH waiting down below!

1080.scene description: PHELPS sees JACK's point of view of the elevator, with GOLITSYN inside.

1090.scene description: ETHAN and SARAH are waiting in front of the elevator, the one GOLITSYN is about to step off of!  ETHAN looks around, for a place to hide.

1094.dialogue: OK.  Taking Golitsyn's exit.  Jack, openthe doors.

1097.dialogue: What about my coat?  I'll freeze.

1104.scene description: PHELPS whips over to a laptop and starts typing.

1109.scene description: He jabs ENTER on his keyboard.

1114.scene description: The elevator doors WHISK open, revealing the empty shaft beyond.  ETHAN and SARAH jump into the shaft.

1121.scene description: ETHAN and SARAH jump down into the five foot empty space below the work room floor.  Above them, the elevator continues its descent, with them hiding below.  The elevator drops to just over their heads and stops.

1128.scene description: GOLITSYN steps off the elevator, crosses the room and slides a 3.5 computer disk into the computer in the work room. Through the Visco glasses, we can clearly see him at work, downloading the vital information.

1135.scene description: Waiting below the elevator, ETHAN takes off his jacket, starting to reverse it.  He checks his Visco wrist monitor as GOLITSYN perpetrates the theft.  He smiles and speaks into a microphone.

1138.dialogue: He's got it.  Saved your ass again Jack.

1151.dialogue: Sarah's reconsidering.  Claire, transport in five minutes.

1160.scene description: Back inside, ETHAN strips off his mask and wearing his now reversed jacket, he and SARAH exit the small door at the base of the elevator shaft.

1166.scene description: JACK rapidly disconnects his equipment.  But as he pulls the final electrical clip from the elevator's wiring, it flashes and SPARKS.

1172.scene description: ETHAN and SARAH exit an Embassy service area by the waterfront and blend into the Embassy crowd, as an amorous couple.

1176.dialogue: In position.  Jack open the door, let thepackage roll.

1185.scene description: ETHANÃ­S voice comes over HANNAHÃ­S earpiece.

1190.scene description: HANNAH breaks off and goes up the stairs.

1194.scene description: The button marked "ROOF" lights up, seemingly all by itself.

1198.scene description: The car engages with a sharp jolt --

1204.scene description: --and starts to rise.  JACK looks down, into the elevatorcar, through the grate.  ThereÃ­s no one in it.

1209.scene description: On one of his monitors, PHELPS sees the elevator moving inthe shaft.

1218.dialogue: IÃ­m not doing anything!  (I donÃ­t have iteither).

1223.scene description: PHELPS is typing at his keyboard and jamming the enter buttonbut gets no response.

1227.dialogue: I donÃ­t have it -- I donÃ­t havecontrol!

1232.scene description: JACKÃ­S face pales.  He looks up, above him, at theapproaching ceiling.

1235.dialogue: Uh -- then I have a problem.

1240.scene description: GOLITSYN pulls out the now-programmed disk from the computer,slips it in his jacket pocket and heads for the door.

1245.scene description: JACK looks up through his Visco glasses at the approachingroof, covered with spikes.

1250.scene description: Through the monitor, ETHAN sees JACKÃ­S P.O.V. of the roof ofthe building approaching.  Fast.

1254.dialogue: Cut the power.  Cut the power Jack.  Doyou hear me.

1260.scene description: On top of the elevator, JACK has ripped open the controlpanel again and is frantically trying to adjust wires to getthe thing to stop.

1263.scene description: He swears, his fingers fumble, he works faster and faster.He looks up.  The roof of the building is nearly upon him.

1269.scene description: JACK looks up again, he cringes, he covers his head with hishands, he SCREAMS --

1271.scene description: --and heÃ­s crushed to death against the roof.

1276.scene description: ETHAN is staring at the static on the monitor that once wasJACKÃ­S signal.

1281.scene description: He closes his eyes, knowing what that means.

1289.dialogue: Man down.  Stay where you are.  IÃ­m on myway.

1291.scene description: He gets up and races out of the apartment.

1298.scene description: GOLITSYN, who now has the disk, jabs again and again at theelevator button but it wonÃ­t even light up.  He studies theelevator doors and jumps into the shaft, just as ETHAN andSARAH did moments before.

1301.scene description: He hits the floor of the elevator shaft and exits the smalldoor at the shaftÃ­s base.

1314.scene description: PHELPS dashes onto the Charles Bridge and heads across theriver, toward the Embassy.  He throws a look back, over hisshoulder.  ParanoiaÃ­s setting in.

1316.scene boundary: EXT. EMBASSY (AS SEEN FROM CHARLES BRIDGE) - NIGHT

1320.scene description: Outside the Embassy, GOLITSYN escapes, pushing through theservice area door and racing past a DRUNKEN COUPLE who are inthe midst of a loverÃ­s quarrel, in Russian.

1325.scene description: Pan past the embankment and onto the bridge where PHELPS isstill racing to meet ETHAN.  But he stops suddenly, as ifhearing something and looks behind him, at the deepeninggloom.

1329.scene description: ETHAN and SARAH hear PHELPÃ­S voice over the monitor.

1332.dialogue: The package is in the open.

1335.dialogue: Jim.  Jim.  HeÃ­s in the open.

1347.scene description: Over ETHANÃ­s shoulder, SARAH sees GOLITSYN getting away.  Fogstarts to roll over the river towards the bridge.

1365.scene description: Seated in the getaway car, CLAIRE listens to JIM and ETHANargue.

1368.dialogue: No, damn it, no, I said ABORT!

1372.scene description: Outside the Embassy, SARAH and ETHAN argue.

1376.dialogue: Sarah eye on the package.  Jim, IÃ­mcoming to you.

1380.dialogue: Jim gave an abort, we should walkaway.

1384.dialogue: No, weÃ­re going to recover the disk,understand?!  Now move!

1386.scene description: ETHAN takes off for the bridge, leaving SARAH to shadow

1391.scene description: HANNAH hurries toward the getaway vehicle.

1395.scene description: ETHAN moves to the bridge stairs.

1568.scene description: There is a long pause and then familiar voice comes on theline.

1576.scene description: Pause.  A funny series of CLICKS comes over the line.

1607.dialogue: Let's just bring you in safely, and thenwe'll worry about that, okay?  Were youfollowed?

1610.scene description: ETHAN closes his eyes.  KITTRIDGEÃ­S voice is strong andreassuring and he needs that right now.

1616.dialogue: DonÃ­t think, be sure.  Are you clean?

1623.dialogue: Location green.  One hour.  IÃ­ll be theremyself.

1652.scene description: ETHAN makes his way past the old town clock, a towering,gothic structure and into a plaza, surrounded mostly by residential buildings.

ETHAN walks to the table, a couple of quick, seemingly cursory glances around the room as he goes.  KITTRIDGE has been working on a pretty good-sized lobster.  He rises to greet ETHAN and they sit.

1680.dialogue: I can't tell you how sorry I am.  I know how much Jim in particular meant to you, Ethan.  Personally as well as professionally.

1685.scene description: He spots a stack of documents on the table.

1689.scene description: ETHAN picks them up.  There's a Canadian picture bearing ETHAN photo and the name Phillipe Doucette, credit cards, driver's license, etc.

1696.dialogue: Passport, visas - you know the drill. We'll work the exfiltration thru Canada, debrief you at Langley.  Throw the Prague police a bone, you know toss them a few suspects.  Follow me?

1702.dialogue: We've lost enough agents for one night.

1706.dialogue: You mean I've lost enough agents for one night.

1709.scene description: KITTRIDGE seems to be at the point of saying one thing, then, carefully:

1713.dialogue: You seem hell bent on blaming yourself, Ethan.

1728.dialogue: Of IMF agents.  At the Embassy.  Tonight.

1735.dialogue: Let's see if you can follow me around this room.

1752.scene description: The figures around the room have grown restless.  KITTRIDGE tries to indicate that it's okay. He pulls some papers out of his jacket.

1759.dialogue: For a little over two years now we've been spotting serious blowback in IMF operations.  We have a penetration.  The other day we decoded a message on the Internet from a Czech we know as "Max."

1772.dialogue: That's right.  Max, it seems, has two unique gifts -- a capacity for anonymityand for corrupting susceptible agents. This time he's gotten to someone on the inside - he's put himself in a position to buy our NOC list. An operation he referred to as "Job 314".  The job he thought Golitsyn was doing tonight.

1775.dialogue: But the list Golitsyn stole was a decoy.

1780.dialogue: Correct the actual list is safe at Langley.  "Golitsyn" was a lightning rod, one of ours.

1783.dialogue: This whole operation was a molehunt.

1787.dialogue: Yes, the mole's deep inside. And -- like you said.  You survived.

1792.dialogue: I want to show you something, Ethan.

1796.scene description: He now shoves the papers across the table.  They're xeroxed copies of a Wisconsin bank account in the name of DONALD and MARGARET ETHAN HUNT.  It shows a balance of $127, 000.

1808.dialogue: Since your father's death, your family's farm has been in sub-chapter S and now, suddenly, they're flush with over a hundred and twenty grand in the bank. Dad's illness was supposed to have wiped out the bank account -- dying slowly in America after all, can be a very expensive proposition Ethan.  So, why don't we go quietly out of here onto the plane...

1814.dialogue: How about if we just go quietly into the bathroom and I wash your mouth out with soap - you pathetic button down bureaucratic asshole.

1818.dialogue: Ethan, I can understand you're very upset.

1822.dialogue: Kitteridge, you've never seen me very upset.

1824.metadata: ETHAN takes something from his jacket pocket.  While

1825.metadata: KITTRIDGE talks, ETHAN unwraps whatever is in his hand.

1833.dialogue: All right, enough is  enough Hunt. You've bribed, cajoled, killed - and relied on intimate loyalties to get away with it. You're determined to shake hands with the devil and I'm going to make sure you do it in hell.

1837.scene description: We see what ETHAN holds in his hand -- it's the piece of bubble gum, half red, half green. He squeezes the gum, mushing the two sides together.

1841.scene description: ETHAN lashes out, swatting KITTRIDGE'S glass of wine off thetable in one quick motion.  As he does, he hurls the piece of gum.

1853.scene description: At the same time, ETHAN bolts for the door.

1858.scene description: ETHAN races out of the restaurant and takes off, into the deserted square.

1862.scene description: Silence.  ETHAN enters the darkened entry.

1868.scene description: ETHAN glances up at the stairwell.  Naked light bulbs illuminate the way up.  He slips off his jacket and shirt, then puts his jacket back on.

1951.scene description: ETHAN pauses, slaking his bottomless thirst and trying to figure out what permutation of "job 314" he should add to the others on his computer screen.  He MUMBLES.

2083.dialogue: Take off your God damn coat!

2109.dialogue: Did they send you...Did they send you?

Kittridge assumes I'm a mole they've been tracing and I've been in the employ of an arms dealer, Max, for the last two years, to get him our NOC list.

2150.scene description: A long moment while she stares at ETHAN's back.

2153.dialogue: What are you going to do?

2160.dialogue: I'm going to get it for him.  Whoever the mole is, I think goes by the name of Job, at least part of the time. 1 can't find him, but if he knows 1 have the NOC list, he'll find me.

2165.dialogue: Ethan, you're not making sense. Let me go in and talk to Kittridge. I'm going to tell him you had nothing to do...

2170.dialogue: Claire, Claire, Claire, if you're not dead, he's going to assume you're with me.

2204.dialogue: Excuse me, could I trouble you for a match?

2217.dialogue: Would you remove your hat please?

2235.scene description: The black hood still on his head, ETHAN has trouble sitting upright.  He's before a desk, in an apartment somewhere in the city -- it's impossible to tell where, as the blinds are drawn.  The place is roomy and lavishly furnished -- expensive Oriental rugs, well-chosen objects of art.

2245.dialogue: You misunderstood.  No one sees Max.

2252.dialogue: Allowing Max to see you and hear what you've got to say.

2256.dialogue: I don't communicate very well through a shroud.

2261.dialogue: If Max doesn't like what you have to say, you'll be wearing that shroud indefinitely.

2264.dialogue: I'm willing to take the chance.

2272.scene description: MAX'S figure into frame.  MATTHIAS removes ETHAN's hood. When it comes off ETHAN finds himself looking up at a tall woman of indeterminate age.  She's handsome to the point of severity.

2286.dialogue: Why not?  You gave Job a hundred and twenty five thousand.

2294.dialogue: The penny drops.  You are not Job.  Yes, Job is not given to quoting Scripture in his communications. And there was its tone -- aggressive but playful.  Job is not playful.  So you're something of a paradox.

2304.dialogue: Whether you like a paradox.  I want a hundred and fifty thousand dollars.

2307.dialogue: It's quite out of the question.

2311.dialogue: The disk Job sold you is worthless.  It's bait, part of an internal molehunt.

2315.dialogue: And how might you know that?  Are you another Company man?

2321.dialogue: Ah, but, we're asking about you.

2330.dialogue: That's the question I want to ask Job.

2334.dialogue: I don't know Job any more than he knows me.

2338.dialogue: Even so, I'm sure you could arrange an introduction.

2348.dialogue: Because I can deliver the actual NOC list.  The one you have is not only worthless, it's certain to be equipped with a homing device to pinpoint your exact location.

2354.dialogue: It's easy to say the disk is worthless when you say I can't look at the information and see if it's worthless. Not a tenable position, sir.

2360.dialogue: Okay, boot it up and in anywhere from thirty seconds to ten minutes you're gonna have Virginia farm boys hopping around you like jackrabbits.

2368.dialogue: Tell you what.  How good's the RF scanner you used in the car?

2375.dialogue: Okay, use it.  But I suggest pack up first.

2383.scene description: MATTHIAS boots up.  There's a little musical noise and the screen brightens.  The computer WHIRS and CLICKS and a complex list of names, addresses, phone numbers and other personal information scrolls by.  But Matthias is watching the digital read-out on the RF scanner.

2387.dialogue: Twenty-six, twenty-seven.  So far so good.

2390.dialogue: That's not so good for you, my friend.

2392.scene description: On the scanner, the digital read-out is now in the thirties.

2403.scene description: She looks from the scanner to ETHAN as if she's trying to make up her mind about something.

2409.dialogue: I'd say you've got about two minutes.

2411.scene description: MAX still doubts it. The OTHER MAN goes to the windows --

2414.scene description: --nothing happens. He opens the French doors that lead out onto a balcony.

2420.scene description: The OTHER MAN comes out on the balcony.  Nothing out here but a beautiful day.  He walks to the railing and looks down at the street.

2423.scene description: Down below, the dog that's still barking is tied to a street sign.  WOOF.  WOOF.  WOOF.  Abruptly, it stops.

2443.scene description: Led by KITTRIDGE, the FIVE IMF AGENTS wearing Kevlar-lined trenchcoats creep through the lobby of the building and hit the stairs. They climb them silently.

2449.scene description: A CLEANING WOMAN is vacuuming the hall carpeting when the AGENTS come up the stairs, guns drawn. Her jaw drops and she turns off the vacuum cleaner.

2457.scene description: KITTRIDGE looks at her sharply and gestures.  She turns the vacuum back on. They reach the door of a certain apartment and --

2463.scene description: -- KICK through it.  The AGENTS swarm into MAX'S apartment, guns waving in all directions.  KITTRIDGE sweeps in between them and takes command of the place --

2466.scene description: --but there's nobody here.  TWO AGENTS race into the bedroom, and just as quickly out again.

2471.scene description: MAX, ETHAN, MATTHIAS and the OTHER MAN move quickly across the bridge that connects Max's apartment to the tower.

2476.scene description: KITTRIDGE kicks open the door to the balcony, comes outside, and looks around.  Nobody in sight.

2481.scene boundary: INT. MAX'S CAR - ETHAN AND MAX - DAY

2485.dialogue: Oh dear, Gunther will never let me use one of his apartments again.

2492.dialogue: Thanks, Max.  Or is it Maxine?

2499.dialogue: I don't have to tell you what a comfort anonymity can be in my profession -- like a warm blanket.

2506.dialogue: What was your deal with Job?

2515.dialogue: Six million dollars.  I'll give you the same.  But I want the complete list now, not just Eastern Europe.  I won't do this piecemeal, it's too dangerous.  I want the entire list, the true name of every non-official cover agent throughout the world.

2522.dialogue: Ten million.  Ten million in negotiable U.S. Treasury certificates, in bearer form, coupons attached.  And one more thing -- your personal assurance that Job will be at the exchange.

2526.dialogue: Done.  Bring it to me in London.  I want it by the end of the week.

2529.dialogue: How will you make sure Job will be there?

2534.dialogue: How will you make sure I'll have the list in three days?  It's been a delight.  Now where can I drop you dear boy?

2538.dialogue: I'm not being dropped anywhere without my money.

2541.scene description: MAX manages to laugh without coughing.  Then, with an admonishing forefinger:

2546.dialogue: I'm going to have to front you personally.  Don't lose that money without losing your life.

2552.scene description: MAX settles back and regards ETHAN.  A theatrical sigh.  She fancies this guy.

2560.scene description: KITTRIDGE waits on the balcony for his AGENTS to complete their search.  HARRY BARNES, a middle-aged, gray suited, somewhat gray-faced bureaucrat, comes to join Kittridge.

2564.dialogue: The man's gone black, Barnes.  He's under until he decides to surface.

2569.dialogue: Look we can use someone from the Embassy and we can get the local authorities involved. Close off his transportation.

2578.dialogue: What can we do, Barnes?  Put a guy at the airport?  How many identities do you think Hunt has?  How many times has he slipped past custom, in how many countries?  These guys are trained to be ghosts.  We taught them how to do it, for Christ's sake!

2588.dialogue: Let's not waste time chasing him.  Make him come to us.  EverybodyÃ­s got pressure points.  Find out something that's important to him personally and you squeeze.

2595.scene description: ETHAN enters the living room.  CLAIRE walks out of the bedroom holding a gun.

2598.scene description: ETHAN reaches into his jacket and holds up a hefty wad of currency.

2601.dialogue: Max made a deal with you?

2604.dialogue: I deliver the NOC list, Max delivers Job.

2612.dialogue: We've got seventy-five rounds for your Glock 9, but only twenty for the Sig Sauer, one pair of Visco glasses with monitor, plenty of passports. You said it yourself -- if I'm not dead, I'm with you.

2620.dialogue: Jim was my husband. I want to know who killed him. ( ALT ) I want to get the son of a bitch who did this.

2624.dialogue: We need help, and we don't have time. They have to be local.

2629.scene boundary: INT. SAFE HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER - DAY

2632.scene description: The KY57 crypto phone, a black box with an ordinary phone receiver in the top, THUNKS down on the table.

2636.scene description: ETHAN plugs the phone cable from his laptop into the back. The green display on top of the KY57 dials a number and makes a computer connection.

2638.scene description: On the computer, the screen says:

2643.scene description: ETHAN types a password and the screen asks him for the

2647.scene description: He types in a single word.

ETHAN, and CLAIRE. LUTHER regards the others warily.

2683.dialogue: In Langley?  The one in Virginia, Langley?

2688.scene description: ETHAN nods.  KRIEGER turns to CLAIRE.

2702.dialogue: If we're going to Virginia, why don't we drop by Fort Knox?  I can fly a helicopter right in through the lobby and  set it down inside the vault and it will be a hell of a lot easier than breaking into the God damn CIA.

2720.dialogue: I don't know.  This I don't know.

2727.dialogue: This doesn't sound like the Luther Stickell I've heard of.  What'd they used to call you?  The Net Ranger?  Phineas Phreak?  The only man alive who actually hacked NATO Ghostcom.

2732.dialogue: There was never any physical evidence that I had anything to do with that.. that..

2738.dialogue: You don't know what you're missing. This is the Mt. Everest of hacks.

2743.dialogue: You're all kidding yourselves. Even with top of the line crypto.  Cray access. STU 3's --

2755.dialogue: May take a little time. That's not what Claire tells me about you.

2760.dialogue: Thinking Machine laptops, I'm talking about the 686 prototypes -- with the artificial intelligence Risk chip --

2767.scene description: ETHAN looks back at LUTHER.  LUTHER thinks.

2771.dialogue: And I get to keep the equipment when we're done.

2775.dialogue: Luther, I guess you're all out of excuses.

2781.dialogue: I can't just hack my way inside.  There's no modem access to the mainframe, it's in a stand-alone.  I'd have to be physically at the terminal.

2785.dialogue: Luther, relax, it's worse than you think. The terminal's in black vault lock-down.

2789.scene description: While ETHAN talks, we see what he's referring to:

2794.scene description: A CIA ANALYST carrying a glass of iced tea and several file folders walks down a long corridor in the headquarters building.  He comes to an impressive guard station and rests his chin on a strange-looking optometric device.

2798.dialogue: They missed nothing in that room.  Even the vents have laser nets over them.

2801.scene description: Apparently the device approves and the ANALYST is buzzed into a "RESTRICTED" area of the building.

2808.scene description: The ANALYST reaches a curtained area. He shoves the curtain aside and comes to a large, vaulted door.  He slides a card- key into a slot, leaves it there and slides a second card-key into the slot beneath it.

2813.dialogue: Inside, there are three countermeasure systems that can only be deactivated by authorized entry.  Which we won't have.

2817.scene description: A panel next to the ANALYST says "INTRUSION COUNTERMEASURES OFF."  The ANALYST next spins a three digit combination code, CHUNKS the door open and steps into --

2824.scene description: -- the secured terminal room.  It's not large but it's impressive.  A single terminal is bolted into the middle of the floor and the glass and tile walls of the room overlook computer storage towers.

2830.dialogue: The first system is sound-sensitive, anything above a whisper sets it off. The second system is on the floor and pressure-sensitive --

2834.scene description: The ANALYST closes the vault door behind him and walks across the room.  As he walks, the floor tiles light up under his feet, turning off again when he lifts the weight from them.

2840.dialogue: --and the third detects any increase in temperature.  Even the body heat of an unauthorized person in the room will trigger it.

2844.scene description: A thermometer on the wall shows the temperature is 72 degrees.  The ANALYST sets his glass down, boots up the computer, and starts entering data from the file folders.

2847.dialogue: All three systems are state of the art.

2851.scene description: The ANALYST turns and takes a sip of his iced tea.  A drop of condensation runs down the glass and hits the floor. When it makes contact, the floor panel lights up.

2856.scene description: The other team members gathered around the table look at ETHAN skeptically.

2859.dialogue: And you really think we can do this.

2865.scene description: The middle of the night and the train is dark. The team members come out of the stateroom to go to bed -- KRIEGER heads in one direction, ETHAN and CLAIRE in the other.

2868.scene description: ETHAN stops.  His attention is drawn to the car ahead. There is a window in the door to the car and he looks through it.

2870.scene boundary: ETHAN'S P.O.V. THRU WINDOW (INT. BUSINESS CAR - NIGHT)

2875.scene description: Ethan sees the business car, a plush space for busy executives to get some work done on the train. There are laptops, cellular phones, desks that fold out in front of spacious seats.

2878.scene description: A FEMALE EXECUTIVE, forty or so, is seated at one of the desks, typing away into her laptop.

2882.scene description: ETHAN knocks on the compartment door.

2895.scene description: ETHAN and CLAIRE enter, ETHAN closing the compartment door. He pulls an envelope from his jacket and holds it out to her. She takes it, waits.

2902.dialogue: It's cash. And a second passport. If anything goes wrong when we're inside, if you sense even the slightest deviation don't look over your shoulder, you walk away - you hear me? Just walk away.

2905.dialogue: You don't think we're going to make it.

2914.dialogue: I just need you to be safe.

2922.dialogue: What about me - Jim called an abort - I didn't comply.  I lost the team. I just need you to be safe.

2925.scene description: CLAIRE's coolness causes ETHAN to hesitate just enough to take it in.

2928.dialogue: I wish I'd never laid eyes on you..

2932.scene description: And they're suddenly, violently in each others arms, kissing and half-falling onto the converted bed.  She suddenly resists.  He senses it and pulls away.

2940.scene description: He rises and goes to the door.  He's got his hand on the knob when CLAIRE wraps her arms around him from behind, turns him to her and kisses him, deeply.  This time they sink slowly to the bed.

2948.scene description: Seen from the air, CIA headquarters is a sprawling complex, two huge buildings surrounded by acres of parking lots hacked out of a thick forest.

2957.scene description: KITTRIDGE, BARNES, and their STAFF are hard at work, photographs and biographical data of ETHAN on various computer and television screens around the room.  KITTRIDGE leans back in his chair, staring at the ceiling.

2962.dialogue: What I want to know is how Hunt accessed the disavowed file, even after we cut off his authorization code.

2968.dialogue: He may have used Phelps' code. They were friends, and Phelps, was still valid for twenty-four hours.

2973.dialogue: If that's the case, we need to implement a system to immediately deactivate an agent's code immediately...

2975.metadata: KITTRIDGE brings his chair legs down on the floor with a

2985.dialogue: I can't believe what I'm listening to. Hunt just kicked us in the ass, you guys are standing here trying to figure out what kind of shoes he had on!  I don'tcare how he did it, I want to know why he did it!  Is he recruiting?  For what purpose?

2988.scene description: From somewhere in the building, an ALARM sounds, not too loud in here.

2995.scene description: The alarm get louder as it goes off in another part of the building.

3002.dialogue: Too short sighted.  This guy's proactive,he initiates.  The question is what does he want now and where does he need to get it and Barnes what the hell is thatnoise?!

3004.scene description: An AGENT is just coming in from the hallway.

3010.dialogue: Oh, for -- do we have to evacuate?

3020.scene boundary: EXT. VIRGINIA TWO LANE HIGHWAY - DAY

3023.scene description: SIRENS BLARING, three fire trucks race past an inconspicuous gray van parked on the shoulder of a two lane highway.

3029.scene description: Three FIREMEN stomp into the main lobby of the CIA headquarters building.  ETHAN and KRIEGER are among them, in firemen's jumpsuits, carrying packs of equipment.

3032.scene description: ETHAN takes a breath as they cross to the GUARD's desk.  He looks up, above him.

3034.scene description: Etched into the top of one wall are the words "AND YE SHALL

3035.scene boundary: KNOW THE TRUTH AND THE TRUTH SHALL MAKE YOU FREE."

3038.scene description: They reach the GUARD.  ETHAN, who wears Visco glasses, elbows to the front of the group and takes charge.

3045.scene description: The GUARD checks a screen in front of him.

3048.dialogue: Yeah.  That's what I've got too.

3051.scene description: The FIREMEN look at each other.  Who is this guy?  But he seems to know what he's talking about, so --

3059.dialogue: Uh -- twenty-one, but there's no alarm in sector twenty-one.

3062.dialogue: I gotta go in there and shut it down!

3066.dialogue: Nobody goes into any sector where the alarm didn't go off.

3070.dialogue: Do you want to blow the fire through the whole building?

3077.scene boundary: EXT. CIA LANGLEY - PARKING AREA - DAY

3081.scene description: One fire truck is parked slightly behind the others in the parking area of the headquarters building.  Second truck roars past.  LUTHER watches it go.

3088.scene description: LUTHER is in the belly of the fire truck with a ton of equipment -- three laptops, a bundle of phone cable, a mini- dish antenna, a cellular phone, several thick phone company manuals with names like "COSMOS" and "SWITCHED ACCESS

3093.scene description: One laptop serves as a Visco monitor, showing a video image in which LUTHER watches ETHAN'S point of view of the stubborn GUARD, who's finishing his sentence.

3100.scene description: LUTHER turns to a screen on another computer and searches through a complex facilities menu.

3107.scene description: He finds what he's looking for and double clicks on it.  A red box on his screen lights up --

3112.scene description: -- and the same red box lights up on the GUARD'S screen. From in the distance, a new ALARM begins to wail.

3115.dialogue: Wait!  Hold it - it's on. Let's go.

3122.scene description: ETHAN turns and looks at one of the FIREMEN behind them -- it's CLAIRE.  CLAIRE and KRIEGER follow ETHAN/GUARD to corridor.

3128.scene description: CLAIRE quickly slips out of her fireman's jumpsuit, revealing a business suit underneath.  She clips an ID tag to her breast pocket.

3132.scene description: She pulls a piece of paper from her pocket, a computer printout of a man's ID photo.  She stares at the face, studying it.

3138.scene description: CLAIRE, carrying a cup of coffee and a muffin, looks for a spot among the tables in the cafeteria of the headquarters building.

3142.scene description: She sees a MAN sitting alone, reading a newspaper.  It's the man whose picture she looked at in the storage room.  She sits next to him.

3145.scene description: He looks up and gives her an acknowledging half smile, then goes back to his paper.

3151.scene description: He turns to pick up the paper and in the moment he is facing the other way, CLAIRE pulls out a small vial resembling a perfume sampler.  She dumps the clear liquid contents into his coffee.  He turns back and hands her part of the paper. CLAIRE smiles.

3154.scene description: COFFEE MAN drinks up.  CLAIRE stares at his shoulder strangely.  He notices.

3156.scene description: She reaches out and flicks something off his shoulder blade.

3161.scene description: He smiles.  But she hasn't flicked something off his shoulder blade, she's flicked something onto it -- a little piece of shiny gray metallic tape.  CLAIRE leaves the table. COFFEE MAN drinks up and leaves the table.

3167.scene description: LUTHER stares at another one of his laptops, this one with a blueprint of the inside of the building.  A cursor begins to flash in one of the rooms.  LUTHER smiles.

3175.scene description: A GUARD carrying an MP5, a handheld machine gun, leads ETHAN and KRIEGER to a heavy metal door marked SERVICE.

3180.scene description: They turn a corner, walking directly past --

3182.scene description: -- COFFEE MAN, who's coming the other way.  We stay with

3189.scene description: COFFEE MAN comes out of the cafeteria, walks down the corridor. he goes to the restricted access door, taps the control panel.

3197.scene description: COFFEE MAN (ANALYST) walks past a GUARD desk and peers into an optometric scanner and we suddenly remember where we've seen COFFEE MAN before.  He's the TECHNICIAN who works at the secured computer terminal.

3202.scene description: ETHAN and KRIEGER in the service area - preparing.  ETHAN putting the mask in a bag.

3212.scene description: The GUARD moves towards ETHAN, who kicks back at him, pushing him back to KRIEGER, who zaps the GUARD on the back of the neck.  He twitches and slumps to the ground, unconscious. KRIEGER quickly grabs him around the neck.

3216.scene description: ETHAN turns.  Holding the GUARD'S head with one hand, KRIEGER pulls a stiletto from the sheath in the back of his belt with the other.  He jabs it toward the base of the GUARD'S skull -

3220.scene description: -- but ETHAN is on him in a flash.  He grabs KRIEGER's knife arm shoving it up against the wall.  Staring into KRIEGER'S face in warning.

3232.scene description: ETHAN releases him and walks away.

3238.scene description: The Guard is tied up, lying on the floor of the Service Area Room.  ETHAN and KRIEGER are below the open vent into the duct system.

3242.scene description: The first climb is straight up.  KRIEGER cups his hands under ETHAN'S foot and lifts him up into the duct as he starts to climb.

3247.scene description: ETHAN and KRIEGER crawl quickly through the ducts, moving horizontally now.  They reach a juncture and turn right.

3252.dialogue: 1 - 2 - 3 - Toast, toast.  Luther, I'm going in.  Don't disappoint me...Krieger, from here on in, absolute silence.

3258.scene description: ETHAN and KRIEGER reach a ventilator shaft in the duct.  A laser net protects the ventilator, red shafts of light cris- crossing every which way.  ETHAN looks down, through the net.

3261.scene description: He can see the computer room below and the top of the TECHNICIAN'S head.

3267.scene description: In the duct, ETHAN signals to KRIEGER, making a triangle of his hands.  KRIEGER wriggles forward and hands him a multi- sided, pyramid shaped glass object.

3271.scene description: ETHAN raises the pyramid and intercepts a portion of one of the laser net's beams. The pyramid glows and we realise what it is -- a prism.

3276.scene description: The laser beam now captive in the prism, ETHAN carefully moves it out of the centre of the ventilator shaft and directs it toward another prism, clearing a path through the shaft.

3283.scene description: Up in the ceiling above it, one of the screws starts to move in the ventilator shaft, unscrewing.  When it appears ready to drop out, a thin strip of metal snakes out from between the bars of the shaft and edges up next to the screw.

3287.scene description: The screw drops out of its hole but it doesn't drop to the floor, it zips over and clings to the side of the metal strip with a gentle CLICK, as to a magnet.

3290.scene description: The screw is pulled up, through the shaft.  Now the whole shaft moves, down, into the room, held by a hand.

3292.scene description: It turns sideways and is pulled up, into the duct.

3297.scene description: A rubber tube snakes down, through the hole, coming to a stop near the thermostat, which says it's seventy-two degrees.  A gentle WHOOSH is audible as frosty air blows through the tube, cooling the room.

3302.scene description: The TECHNICIAN defaults the security systems outside the terminal room.

3308.scene description: It is eerily still in the locked-down computer room we saw earlier.  No-one is there, there's not a sound but for the gentle HUM of the computer as it waits to be put to use.

3311.scene description: Now ETHAN's head descends slowly into the room, his hair falling in front of him.

3316.scene description: At first it seems he's just poking his head in for a look, but he keeps coming and coming -- first his head, then shoulders, then waist, then knees, and finally we see his ankles and understand.

3321.scene description: He is lowered to stop in front of the thermometer and temperature read out on the computer.  Suddenly ETHAN is lifted back up quickly to hang at ceiling height above the computer as the ANALYST enters the room.

3326.scene description: The TECHNICIAN crosses to the computer and sits down, a stack of work to his right.

3331.scene description: The TECHNICIAN is working away at the computer.  He pauses and wipes some sweat from his forehead.

3336.scene description: With a strange look on his face, the TECHNICIAN looks up. It's almost as if he senses ETHAN above him but instead --

3345.scene description: He reaches for the garbage can and upchucks again.  Puzzled, sick and feeling another wave coming on, he drags himself to his feet, hauls himself across the room and leaves.

3351.scene description: Even sick, the TECHNICIAN still thinks to re-activate the alarm systems with a card-key.  They HUM back to life efficiently, a light flashing:

3359.scene description: ETHAN descends again, slowly but steadily, until he is at the same height as the computer terminal to hang horizontally in front of the computer.

3363.scene description: A heavy velcro strap binds his ankles together, secured by a rope that leads up into the ventilator shaft and through the set of pulleys.

3368.scene description: KRIEGER holds the rope, his jaw clenched, sweat breaking out on his forehead.

3373.scene description: Unfortunately, he's three feet away from it.  He stretches his arms but can't reach.

3376.scene description: He blinks, unable to believe this.  He curls himself into a situp and looks up, into the shaft.

3386.scene description: ETHAN gestures to him, pointing to the floor.  Slowly, KRIEGER drops him another few feet.  Now ETHAN's lower than the terminal and still three feet away from it.

3389.scene description: He closes his eyes, summoning his strength and does another situp, bringing himself up right in front of the terminal.

3395.scene description: In the fire truck, LUTHER, who is watching on the Visco monitor, turns his head upside down to get a look at what ETHAN sees.

3399.scene description: He cups his hands around the microphone of his headset and begins to whisper.  We hear only the moist, airy sound of his breath, not the words.

3406.dialogue: Type this password: AW96B6.  Return.  Go to the files menu, find the NOC list file.  Open "NOC List."  Put your diskette in.  Double click on the NOC list.

3412.scene description: ETHAN's ear receiver WHISPERS ever-so-slightly.  He reaches out, to the upside down keyboard, cranes his head to see itand starts typing, softly.

3416.scene description: The computer HUMS, activated.  ETHAN unbuttons his pocket, withdraws a 3.5 disk and slides it gently into the floppy drive.

3419.scene description: The computer accepts it with a soft WHIR.  ETHAN winces, even that soft sound is deafening in these circumstances.

3427.scene description: LUTHER cranes his head again to see the computer terminal through ETHAN's trembling viewpoint.  He WHISPERS more commands.

3433.dialogue: Ok, good!  It's scrolling.  0K, now we're going to download.  Edit menu.  Select "copy to disc".  You're downloading. When it's all green it's done.

3438.scene description: ETHAN types in the contends, presses enter and the screen displays a comforting message:

3446.scene description: LUTHER'S eyes widen as he gets his first look, on the Visco monitor, of the specific information they're downloading. The NOC list.

3454.scene description: KRIEGER shakes with the strain of holding the rope.  His eyes suddenly widen as he sees something next to him.

3458.scene description: It's a rat.  KRIEGER stares. The rat stares back.  Neither moves.  Puzzled by KRIEGER'S lack of response, the rat crawls forward, inquisitive.

3461.scene description: KRIEGER's eyes water, his nose twitches.  He's about to sneeze.

3466.scene description: LUTHER pulls himself together and WHISPERS another command into the microphone.

3474.scene description: The 3.5 disk is ejected from the floppy drive.  ETHAN pockets it and signals to be raised.

3477.scene description: Slowly, his body starts to move up.  As it does, a bead of sweat rolls down his nose, balling at the tip.

3481.scene description: ETHAN ignores it.  But below him, he sees the floor tiles, four of them lit up under the wheels of the chair at the computer terminal.

3483.scene description: His eyes widen as he realizes something --

3487.scene description: --and he catches it with his right hand.

3492.scene description: CIA ANALYST crosses corridor from restricted access door to bathroom.

3497.scene description: A toilet FLUSHES, smashing the silence, and the TECHNICIAN staggers out of the bathroom. He goes to the sink and throws some water on his face. He's still unaware of the piece of shiny metallic tape stuck to his shoulder blade.

3499.scene description: He walks out of the bathroom, crosses corridor to door.

3504.scene description: On one of LUTHER'S laptops, the blinking cursor starts to move down a corridor.  LUTHER speaks into his microphone.

3513.scene description: ETHAN is near the ceiling, but KRIEGER isn't pulling any more.  ETHAN looks up at him, wide-eyed and gestures to pull him up.  KRIEGER shakes his head no.

3519.scene description: The cursor is halfway across the screen.

3522.dialogue: Get out of there -- get out of there --

3527.scene description: ETHAN still dangles.  Holding the rope with one hand, KRIEGER holds out his other, demanding something.  He wants the disk.

3532.scene description: The TECHNICIAN makes his way back down the corridor, toward the computer room.

3537.scene description: The blinking cursor is near the edge of the screen and LUTHERis sweating.

3541.dialogue: He's at the vault - get moving!  1 yellow, 2 yellows...Toast!

3546.scene description: ETHAN, still hanging upside down, has refused.  KRIEGER demands again.

3550.scene description: The TECHNICIAN passes through the optometric scanner.

3569.scene description: ETHAN has the diskette in his mouth.  KRIEGER leans down and takes it.  He drops the knife.

3580.scene description: The TECHNICIAN deactivates the alarm systems, swings the door open and comes back into the room.

3584.scene description: He turns to close the door behind him and in so doing just misses seeing ETHAN'S head as it is pulled back up into the ceiling.

3591.scene description: ETHAN throws smoke cannisters and he and KRIEGER crawl frantically back through the duct, the way they came.

3596.scene description: CLAIRE walks quickly past the GUARDS in the reception area and out of the building.

3603.scene description: The TECHNICIAN enters the room and shuts the door.  He sees the knife, picks it up, looks at it and then puts it down. He resumes his work at the computer but when he punches up his program, something prints out on his screen.  Its header:

3610.scene description: And it goes on.  The TECHNICIAN'S eyes widen in disbelief. He spins back in his chair and reaches for the nearest telephone.

3615.scene description: In the communications room, tempers are running a little high.  KITTRIDGE is on his feet, berating his staff.

3621.dialogue: Think, for Christ's sake, you guys are mired in detail, open your minds, it's gotta be staring us in the face!  What does Ethan Hunt want?!

3625.dialogue: Same thing he wanted in Prague!  Same thing he's always wanted!  The NOC list!

3631.scene description: Now it's coming together in KITTRIDGE'S mind and a horrible thought occurs to him.

3634.dialogue: And where is the list vulnerable?

3637.scene description: There is nervous silence for a moment.  Behind KITTRIDGE, on the other side of the room, the phone starts to ring.

3640.scene description: An AGENT gets up to answer it as a creeping fear pervades the room.

3648.scene description: Nervous laughter goes around the table.  It fades.  On the other side of the room, the AGENT who answered the phone turns, receiver in hand, face ashen.

3651.scene description: He holds the phone out to KITTRIDGE, terrified, the bearer of extremely bad news.

3654.scene description: They all turn slowly and look at him.  He holds the phone out to KITTRIDGE, shaking slightly.

3668.scene description: It may be a HUMAN SCREAM or it may be a SIREN'S WAIL but it echoes over the forest as a lone fire truck ROARS away from the headquarters building, making its escape.

3675.scene description: LUTHER, KRIEGER, CLAIRE and ETHAN, the victorious team, are in the truck's cab.  They exchange looks of massive relief. But no one speaks.  LUTHER, in particular, looks heavily troubled by what they've just done.

3678.scene description: ETHAN looks at CLAIRE, who is jammed into the seat next to him.  She drops her head on his shoulder, exhausted.

3680.scene description: KRIEGER, in the driver's seat literally and figuratively.

3682.scene description: ETHAN just looks straight ahead and to CLAIRE.

3691.scene description: The TECHNICIAN who discovered the theft of the list sits at one end of the now-empty conference table in the communications room.  KITTRIDGE sits in a chair beside, staring gravely at him.

3694.scene description: He gets up and walks to the door, where HARRY BARNES hovers. KITTRIDGE lowers his voice, it's barely audible.

3704.scene description: He gestures to the TECHNICIAN, who watches them anxiously.

3709.dialogue: I want him manning a radar tower in Alaska by the end of the day.  Just mail him his clothes.

3712.scene description: He leaves.  Barnes turns to the TECHNICIAN, who looks up at him anxiously.

3720.scene description: Night. This street is a row of nondescript hotels, one after the other, with anonymous names like "Hotel Pomeroy," "Hotel Vincent," and "Hotel Berridge."

3731.scene description: This barely furnished flat is as nondescript as the row of buildings it's in.  ETHAN hurriedly digs through an overnight bag until he finds what he's looking for -- the now-battered bible he's used to contact Max.  He flips through the pages and crosses the room to his laptop, which is powered up and waiting on the tiny desk.

3735.scene description: LUTHER, alone in a chair across the room. is seriously preoccupied.  KRIEGER is sprawled-on a ratty sofa, hoisting a lager and watching CNN.

3737.scene description: CLAIRE is at the window staring out, anxious.

3739.scene description: KRIEGER glances over the back of the sofa at ETHAN.

3747.scene description: From the desk, ETHAN glances up.  Then goes back to the computer.  KRIEGER continues to glare over the sofa back.

3757.scene description: ETHAN ignores him, working.  His computer jams with static as it connects to a BBS.  The screen blinks and displays the familiar Bible group service through which he's contacted Max.  When it asks him which chapter and verse for the posting, ETHAN flicks through the Bible, looking for the next code.  He  begins to type.

3766.scene description: KRIEGER suddenly appears over his shoulder and knocks bible out of Ethan's hands to the floor.

3769.dialogue: You're not going to any meeting without me.

3775.scene description: He goes back to the computer, his finger hovering over the "ENTER" button.

3779.scene description: LUTHER and CLAIRE watch this growing conflict closely. ETHAN sighs and stands up.  KRIEGER pulls out the blue disk he took from ETHAN in the computer room and waves it in front of him.

3784.dialogue: I don't think you're in any position to give orders, do you?  Not while I'm holding this.

3794.dialogue: Stay out of this. OR Lachez - moi OR  T'agueue

3800.scene description: He reaches into his briefcase and pulls out an identical disk.  He puts it back in his jacket pocket.

3805.dialogue: That's not it.  That's not the list.

3809.dialogue: What's the matter, you don't know this trick?

3812.scene description: He holds the jacket pocket wide open, for KRIEGER to look into.  KRIEGER does.  The pocket is empty.

3819.scene description: ETHAN walks over to CLAIRE, reaches into the pocket of the trousers she's wearing and pulls out the disk.

3824.scene description: He palms the disk in his right hand.

3830.dialogue: I know what you're thinking, Krieger. You're thinking, back in the computer room -- I was up here -- he was down there -- .  He was carrying two discs.

3834.scene description: While he talks, he rotates his hand, palm away from KRIEGER. When he rotates it back, the disk is gone again.  He holds up his left hand.  It's there now.

3837.dialogue: So hard to keep track of these things.

3839.scene description: ETHAN shows his hands -- now both are empty.

3845.scene description: ETHAN pats his pockets, pretending to be frantic.

3849.dialogue: I thought you had it!  Do you actually think I'd let you have the NOC list?

3853.scene description: KRIEGER just stares at him, shaken.  CLAIRE laughs.  KRIEGER looks at her.  He turns completely red.  When he looks back at ETHAN, ETHAN holds two disks -- one in each hand.

3857.dialogue: Try any sleight-of-hand with my money and IÃ­ll cut your throat.

3861.scene description: He tosses his worthless disk into the trash can and storms out, SLAMMING the door behind him.  ETHAN picks up the Bible and sees Drake Hotel.

3865.dialogue: I'm so sorry.  Krieger was my call.  I've never worked with him.  I'm sorry, Ethan.

3868.dialogue: We did what we had to do.

3871.dialogue: I'm going to try and get some sleep.

3874.scene description: She leaves, closing the door behind her, leaving ETHAN and LUTHER alone.

3880.scene description: ETHAN waits a moment, then casually walks to the trash can, picks up the disk KRIEGER threw out and brushes it off carefully.

3883.scene description: He replaces it, in the trash, with the blue disk from his jacket pocket.

3886.dialogue: Krieger did have the NOC list.

3889.dialogue: Now I want you to hold onto it.

3896.dialogue: Because if you knew what you were getting into, you never would have done it.

3900.dialogue: I'm not letting this list get out in the open.

3906.dialogue: Exactly, that's your job.  Tomorrow on the train, you can't let this list get out into the open.  What's the range of this thing?

3910.dialogue: It's hard to tell.  I'm gonna have to be close.

3918.dialogue: Ethan I need to talk to you.

3921.scene description: ETHAN follows CLAIRE into her room where she shows him the television screen.

3925.scene description: On the screen, an anchor in the CNN news center.

3935.dialogue: The unlikely setting...a farm in the heartland of America...the State of Wisconsin, where federal agents claim to have broken the brain trust behind an international drug ring.  For a report we go live now to CNN correspondent (Joe Jones) in the state capitol, Madison. (Joe)...?

3937.scene description: CNN reporter speaks to camera, on the steps of a courthouse.

3941.dialogue: Authorities have identified the couple as Margaret Ethan Hunt and Donald Hunt.

3951.scene description: An OLDER COUPLE, mid-sixties, exit the doors and are led down the steps of the courthouse in shackles.  The Reporter and other news crews race up to the door.

She hands it to Matthias who strips offthe velcro covering and slots it into the drive next to thecomputer in the briefcase.  He boots it up quickly and turnsthe briefcase containing the computer toward MAX for her tosee.

4978.scene description: PHELPS climbs up a ladder past an inert engineer slumped over the control panel -- an obvious earlier victim of PHELPS. PHELPS puts on a pair of clear goggles, reaches a trap door and climbs through it --

4985.scene description: -- halfway out onto the roof of the train.  He reaches into his jacket pocket and pulls out a suction cup with a handle on the end of it.  He SMACKS the suction cup down on the roof and pulls himself the rest of the way out.

4992.scene description: Now for the tough part.  Using the suction cups, PHELPS slowly pulls himself forward, a foot at a time, pulling and replanting the cups as he goes.

5002.scene description: He looks up, scanning the sky behind the train.  From out of the fog, a helicopter approaches.

5006.scene description: PHELPS turns and looks ahead, in the direction the train is going.  In the distance, he can see the chunnel approaching the tunnel under the English Channel.  His eyes widen.

5011.scene description: KRIEGER is at the controls.  He sees the approaching tunnel as well.

5016.scene description: PHELPS crawls like hell to get into position.  Looking up, he sees KRIEGER pointing frantically behind him. PHELPS turns.

5018.scene description: ETHAN is climbing out the trap door.

5021.scene description: A cable and hook swing down from the helicopter, almost touching the roof of the train. PHELPS crawls closer to it.

5025.scene description: ETHAN, behind him, is in a far more precarious position. Without goggles or suction cups, he has to use his fingers to grab small holes on the roof.

5028.scene description: He is flipped over by the wind, ending up facing the other way.  Loses his grip and is blown backwards over the roof.

5034.scene description: KRIEGER sees the Chunnel entrance approaching.  He gestures to PHELPS and tries to move the cable closer to him, passing over PHELPS and then back to him.

5040.scene description: PHELPS grabs the cable and is about to hook the cable onto his belt, ETHAN slides into him and they both crash onto the roof.

5043.scene description: ETHAN grabs the cable out of PHELPS hand and clips it onto the roof.

5046.scene description: PHELPS and ETHAN struggle, but they are hurtling dangerously closer to the chunnel entrance.

5048.scene description: They're now right on top of the chunnel entrance.

5053.scene description: KRIEGER sees the tunnel, only seconds away now.  He paws at the controls, jerking back desperately on a certain lever.

5059.scene description: PHELPS kicks ETHAN and he falls off the far side of the train.  PHELPS falls off the near side and holding onto the strap manages to pull himself back on.

5061.scene description: -- The train ZOOMS into the tunnel --

5063.scene boundary: -- AND THE HELICOPTER ROARS RIGHT IN BEHIND IT!

5069.scene description: As the train roars into the tunnel, the business car goes nearly dark and the message on MAX'S computer screen changes one last time.  This time it says:

5105.scene description: PHELPS paws for one of the suction cups and pulls himself back onto the roof of the train.  ETHAN reaches for the other cup.

5143.scene description: PHELPS and ETHAN now hang on the skids, facing one another. Crouching on the skid, ETHAN digs in his pocket and pulls out --

5259.dialogue: You're more than that, Luther.  They were mistaken about you and they're trying to show you they know it.  They want you back in.

5264.dialogue: Sure.  They want me back in so I won't break in!  They still can't figure out how we did it.

5267.dialogue: You didn't tell 'em at the debriefing?

5273.dialogue: I figured I'd let 'em reinstate my back pay, give me a promotion, check out my office at Langley and then, maybe, talk about it.

5280.dialogue: Why don't you come back with me?

5283.dialogue: Just don't know why I'd be doing it.

5286.dialogue: You really liked Phelps, didn't you?

5293.dialogue: He was a good guy for a long, long time. Just - not long enough. (looks up) Gotta catch my flight..(rising) So.  How's it feel being a solid citizen again?

5297.dialogue: Oh man...I don't know.  I'm gonna miss being disreputable.

5301.dialogue: Well, Luther - if it makes you feel any better I'll always think of you that way.

5306.scene description: The two men understand one another and LUTHER will say no more.  The two exchange slight gestures of farewell and in a moment ETHAN disappears from the bar, leaving a contemplative LUTHER looking after him.

5312.scene description: ETHAN HUNT slumps down in his scat, dosing. A FLIGHT ATTENDANT makes her way down the aisle, holding a case filled with movie cassettes. She stops before a lady passenger.

5316.dialogue: Would you like to watch a movie, Miss Clarke?

5322.dialogue: Excuse me, Mr. Hunt.  Would you like towatch a movie.

5329.dialogue: Would you consider the cinema of the Caribbean?

5332.scene description: ETHAN just stares at her.  This couldn't be what it's sounding like.

5338.scene description: The camera moves into ETHAN's face.  They found him.  They want him back.  He looks up at her and.....
